entry.title: A mnemonic device for Cauchy-Riemann equations
entry.content:
Recall that if z=x+iyz = x + iyz=x+iy, where xxx and yyy are real, then

x=z+zˉ2,y=z−zˉ2i.x = \frac{z + \bar{z}} {2}, \quad y = \frac{z - \bar{z}} {2i}. x=2z+zˉ​,y=2iz−zˉ​.

zˉ\bar{z}zˉ stands for the complex conjugate (x−yix - yix−yi) of zzz.

Suppose that f(z)=f(x,y)=u(x,y)+iv(x,y)f(z)=f(x,y)=u(x,y)+iv(x,y)f(z)=f(x,y)=u(x,y)+iv(x,y). Then

∂f∂z=∂f∂x∂x∂z+∂f∂y∂y∂z=12(∂f∂x+1i∂f∂y)=12(∂f∂x−i∂f∂y),\frac{\partial f}{\partial z}=\frac{\partial f}{\partial x}\frac{\partial x}{\partial z}+\frac{\partial f}{\partial y}\frac{\partial y}{\partial z}=\frac12 \left( \frac{\partial f}{\partial x}+\frac{1}{i}\frac{\partial f}{\partial y}\right)=\frac12 \left( \frac{\partial f}{\partial x}-i\frac{\partial f}{\partial y}\right), ∂z∂f​=∂x∂f​∂z∂x​+∂y∂f​∂z∂y​=21​(∂x∂f​+i1​∂y∂f​)=21​(∂x∂f​−i∂y∂f​),

∂f∂zˉ=∂f∂x∂x∂zˉ+∂f∂y∂y∂zˉ=12(∂f∂x−1i∂f∂y)=12(∂f∂x+i∂f∂y).\frac{\partial f}{\partial \bar{z}}=\frac{\partial f}{\partial x}\frac{\partial x}{\partial \bar{z}}+\frac{\partial f}{\partial y}\frac{\partial y}{\partial \bar{z}}=\frac12 \left( \frac{\partial f}{\partial x}-\frac{1}{i}\frac{\partial f}{\partial y}\right)=\frac12 \left( \frac{\partial f}{\partial x}+i\frac{\partial f}{\partial y}\right). ∂zˉ∂f​=∂x∂f​∂zˉ∂x​+∂y∂f​∂zˉ∂y​=21​(∂x∂f​−i1​∂y∂f​)=21​(∂x∂f​+i∂y∂f​).

These expressions suggest the definitions:

∂∂z=12(∂∂x−i∂∂y),∂∂zˉ=12(∂∂x+i∂∂y).\frac{\partial}{\partial z}=\frac12 \left( \frac{\partial}{\partial x}-i\frac{\partial}{\partial y}\right), \quad \frac{\partial}{\partial \bar{z}}=\frac12 \left( \frac{\partial}{\partial x}+i\frac{\partial}{\partial y}\right). ∂z∂​=21​(∂x∂​−i∂y∂​),∂zˉ∂​=21​(∂x∂​+i∂y∂​).

We know that zˉ2\bar{z}^2zˉ2 is nowhere analytic, and that neither is zˉz\bar{z}zzˉz. On the contrary, z2z^2z2 is analytic everywhere. This suggests the following computation:

∂f∂zˉ=12(∂∂x+i∂∂y)(u+iv)=12(∂u∂x−∂v∂y)+i2(∂v∂x+∂u∂y).\frac{\partial f}{\partial \bar{z}} = \frac12 \left( \frac{\partial}{\partial x}+i\frac{\partial}{\partial y}\right)(u+iv)=\frac12 \left( \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}-\frac{\partial v}{\partial y}\right)+\frac{i}{2}\left( \frac{\partial v}{\partial x}+\frac{\partial u}{\partial y}\right). ∂zˉ∂f​=21​(∂x∂​+i∂y∂​)(u+iv)=21​(∂x∂u​−∂y∂v​)+2i​(∂x∂v​+∂y∂u​).

Nice! We observe that

∂f∂zˉ=0⟺Cauchy-Riemann equations.\frac{\partial f}{\partial \bar{z}} = 0 \quad \Longleftrightarrow \quad \text{Cauchy-Riemann equations}. ∂zˉ∂f​=0⟺Cauchy-Riemann equations.

This is really a good mnemonic (/nəˈmɒnɪk/, the first m is not pronounced) device!

By the way, the following proposition is very useful.

Suppose that

  • a function fff is analytic throughout a domain DDD;
  • f(z)=0f(z)=0f(z)=0 at each point zzz of a domain or line segment contained in DDD.

Then f(z)≡0f(z)\equiv 0f(z)≡0 in DDD; that is, f(z)f(z)f(z) is identically equal to zero throughout DDD.

Suppose that f(z)=f(x,y)=u(x,y)+iv(x,y)f(z)=f(x,y)=u(x,y)+iv(x,y)f(z)=f(x,y)=u(x,y)+iv(x,y) is analytic throughout a domain DDD and that DDD contains a line segment L:a≤x≤b, y=0L: a \leq x \leq b, \ y = 0L:a≤x≤b, y=0. If, in addition, g(z)=u(z,0)+iv(z,0)g(z)=u(z,0)+iv(z,0)g(z)=u(z,0)+iv(z,0) is analytic throughout DDD, then the analytic function h(z):=f(z)−g(z)h(z):=f(z)-g(z)h(z):=f(z)−g(z) is 0 at each point of LLL. We conclude that f(z)≡g(z)f(z) \equiv g(z)f(z)≡g(z) throughout DDD.

For example, f(z)=f(x,y)=(excos⁡y+x2−y2)+i(exsin⁡y+2xy)f(z)=f(x,y)=(e^x \cos y + x^2 - y^2) + i \left( e^x \sin y + 2xy \right)f(z)=f(x,y)=(excosy+x2−y2)+i(exsiny+2xy) is known to be analytic everywhere. Since this is an elementary function, replacing xxx by zzz and yyy by 000 produces another everywhere analytic function ez+z2e^z +z^2ez+z2. By the proposition above, f(z)=ez+z2f(z) = e^z +z^2f(z)=ez+z2. This is the same as f(z+zˉ2,z−zˉ2i)f(\frac{z + \bar{z}} {2},\frac{z - \bar{z}} {2i})f(2z+zˉ​,2iz−zˉ​). What a trick!

File name: PyList.java

package python_list;

/**
 * PyList: Emulates a Python list.
 * </p>
 * To create a new String list called {@code ps}:
 * </p>
 * {@code PyList<String> ps = new PyList<String>();}
 * </p>
 * To create a new list called {@code po}, whose element type is undetermined:
 * </p>
 * {@code PyList<Object> po = new PyList<Object>();}
 */
// The following line suppresses warnings concerning "unchecked".
@SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
public class PyList<E> {

    public static final int MAX_LENGTH = 150;
    private final E[] list;
    private int size;

    /** Initializes the list. */
    public PyList() {
        this.list = (E[]) new Object[MAX_LENGTH];
        this.resets();
    }

    /**
     * Initializes the list with {@code data}. The elements of {@code data} will be
     * appended to the list.
     * 
     * @param data the elements to be appended.
     */
    public PyList(final E... data) {
        this();
        this.appends(data);
    }

    /**
     * Initializes the list with {@code py_lists}. The elements of {@code py_lists}
     * will be appended to the list.
     * 
     * @param py_lists the lists to be appended.
     */
    public PyList(final PyList<E>... py_lists) {
        this();
        this.appends(py_lists);
    }

    /** Does nothing. */
    public void appends() {

    }

    /**
     * Appends the elements of {@code data} to the list.
     * 
     * @param data the elements to be appended.
     */
    public void appends(final E... data) {
        for (final E datum : data) {
            this.sets(this.length(), datum);
        }
    }

    /**
     * Appends the elements of {@code py_lists} to the list.
     * 
     * @param py_lists the lists to be appended.
     */
    public void appends(final PyList<E>... py_lists) {
        for (final PyList<E> py_list : py_lists) {
            for (int i = 0; i < py_list.length(); i++) {
                this.appends(py_list.visits(i));
            }
        }
    }

    /**
     * Appends {@code element} to the list if it was not in the list.
     * 
     * @param element the element to be appended.
     * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code element} was not in the list.
     */
    public boolean appendsIfAbsent(final E element) {
        if (!this.contains(element)) {
            this.appends(element);
            return true;
        }
        return false;
    }

    /**
     * Validates whether {@code element} is in the list.
     * 
     * @param element the element to be searched.
     * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code element} is in the list.
     */
    public boolean contains(final E element) {
        return this.indexOf(element) != -1;
    }

    /**
     * Validates whether the list contains only elements of {@code allowedElements}.
     * 
     * @param allowedElements the array of allowed elements.
     * @return {@code true} if and only if the list contains only elements of
     *         {@code allowedElements}.
     */
    public boolean containsOnly(final E... allowedElements) {
        final PyList<E> allowedElements_list = new PyList<E>(allowedElements);
        for (int i = 0; i < this.length(); i++) {
            if (!allowedElements_list.contains(this.visits(i))) {
                return false;
            }
        }
        return true;
    }

    @Override
    public boolean equals(final Object other) {
        if (this == other) {
            return true;
        }
        if (other instanceof PyList) {
            final PyList<E> py_list = (PyList<E>) other;
            int n = this.length();
            if (n == py_list.length()) {
                int i = 0;
                while (n != 0) {
                    n--;
                    if (this.visits(i) != py_list.visits(i)) {
                        return false;
                    }
                    i++;
                }
                return true;
            }
        }
        return false;
    }

    /**
     * A shortcut to {@code indexOf(element, 0)}.
     * 
     * @param element the element to be searched.
     * @return {@code indexOf(element, 0)}.
     */
    public int indexOf(final E element) {
        return this.indexOf(element, 0);
    }

    /**
     * Looks for the index {@code i} with the properties that {@code beginIndex < i}
     * and that the element at index {@code i} is {@code element}. Gives -1 if no
     * such index exists.
     * 
     * @param element    the element to be searched.
     * @param beginIndex the beginning index.
     * @return the index with the properties above, or -1 if no such index exists.
     */
    public int indexOf(final E element, final int beginIndex) {
        if (element == null) {
            for (int index = beginIndex; index < this.length(); index++) {
                if (this.visits(index) == null) {
                    return index;
                }
            }
        } else {
            for (int index = beginIndex; index < this.length(); index++) {
                if (this.visits(index).equals(element)) {
                    return index;
                }
            }
        }
        return -1;
    }

    /**
     * Inserts {@code element} before {@code index}.
     * 
     * @param index   the index.
     * @param element the element to be inserted.
     */
    public void inserts(final int index, final E element) {
        if (index >= this.length()) {
            this.appends(element);
        } else {
            int i = this.length();
            while (i != index) {
                i--;
                this.sets(i + 1, this.visits(i));
            }
            this.sets(index, element);
        }
    }

    /**
     * Gives the length of the list.
     * 
     * @return the length of the size.
     */
    public int length() {
        return this.size;
    }

    /**
     * Gives the last element and removes it.
     * 
     * @return the last element.
     */
    public E pops() {
        return this.pops(this.length() - 1);
    }

    /**
     * Gives the element at index {@code index} and removes it.
     * 
     * @param index the index.
     * @return the element at index {@code index}.
     */
    public E pops(final int index) {
        final PyList<E> temp_list = new PyList<E>();
        final E integer_popped = this.visits(index);
        for (int i = 0; i < this.length(); i++) {
            if (i != index) {
                temp_list.appends(this.visits(i));
            }
        }
        this.replacedBy(temp_list);
        return (E) integer_popped;
    }

    /**
     * Replaces the current list by {@code py_list}.
     * 
     * @param py_list the list.
     */
    public void replacedBy(final PyList<E> py_list) {
        this.resets();
        this.appends(py_list);
    }

    /** Resets the list. */
    public void resets() {
        for (int i = 0; i < PyList.MAX_LENGTH; i++) {
            this.list[i] = null;
        }
        this.size = 0;
    }

    /**
     * Sets the element at index {@code index} to be {@code element}.
     * 
     * @param index   the index.
     * @param element the element.
     */
    public void sets(final int index, final E element) {
        this.list[index] = element;
        if (index >= this.size) {
            this.size = index + 1;
        }
    }

    /**
     * Gives the sorted list of the given one.
     * 
     * @param py_list the list to be sorted.
     * @return the sorted list.
     */
    public static PyList<Integer> sorted(final PyList<Integer> py_list) {
        final PyList<Integer> sorted_list = new PyList<Integer>(py_list);
        int temporary = 0;
        for (int i = 0; i < sorted_list.length() - 1; i++) {
            for (int j = i + 1; j < sorted_list.length(); j++) {
                if (sorted_list.visits(i) > sorted_list.visits(j)) {
                    temporary = sorted_list.visits(i);
                    sorted_list.sets(i, sorted_list.visits(j));
                    sorted_list.sets(j, temporary);
                }
            }
        }
        return sorted_list;
    }

    /**
     * Appends all elements of the list to a given array. Because of a bug, an array
     * E[] must be passed as a parameter. Here is an example:
     * </p>
     * {@code PyList<String> k = new PyList<String>("1a", "2b");}
     * </p>
     * {@code System.out.println(k.toArray(new String[k.length()])[1]);}
     * </p>
     * This prints {@code 2b}.
     * 
     * @param array the array to be appended.
     * @return an array consisting of elements of the list.
     */
    public E[] toArray(final E[] array) {
        for (int i = 0; i < this.length(); i++) {
            array[i] = this.visits(i);
        }
        return array;
    }

    /**
     * Converts the list to a set.
     * 
     * @return a list with no element occurring more than one time.
     */
    public PyList<E> toSet() {
        final PyList<E> set = new PyList<E>();
        for (int i = 0; i < this.length(); i++) {
            set.appendsIfAbsent(this.visits(i));
        }
        return set;
    }

    @Override
    public String toString() {
        String text = "[";
        int index = 0;
        for (; index < this.length() - 1; index++) {
            text += "" + this.visits(index) + ", ";
        }
        text += "" + this.visits(index) + "]";
        return text;
    }

    /**
     * Visits the element at index {@code index}.
     * 
     * @param index the index.
     * @return the element at index {@code index}.
     */
    public E visits(final int index) {
        return this.list[index];
    }

}

package one_and_two;

/**
 * GCD
 */
public class GCD {

    /**
     * Gives a Bézout expression.
     * 
     * @param a the first integer.
     * @param b the second integer.
     * @return the expression "au + bv = gcd(a, b)" in the string form.
     */
    public static String Bézout(int a, int b) {
        int[] t = GCD.Bézout_implementation(a, b);
        return String.format("%d * %d + %d * %d = %d", a, t[0], b, t[1], t[2]);
    }

    /**
     * Finds a pair of integers u, v such that au + bv = gcd(a, b).
     * 
     * @param a the first integer.
     * @param b the second integer.
     * @return { u, v, gcd(a, b) }.
     */
    public static int[] Bézout_implementation(final int a, final int b) {
        // Set f = { a, b, -1 }. It is not hard to see
        // inner_product(f0, t0) = 0
        // inner_product(f0, t1) = 0
        // Since all the 3D vectors are linear combinations of t0 and t1
        // the result is also orthogonal to f
        // The euclidean algorithm shows that the third component
        // of the result is the GCD (greatest common divisor)
        // of a and b
        final int[] t0 = { 1, 0, a };
        final int[] t1 = { 0, 1, b };
        final int[] temp = { 1, 0, a };
        int q = 0;
        int r = 0;
        while (t1[2] != 0) {
            temp[0] = t0[0];
            temp[1] = t0[1];
            temp[2] = t0[2];
            t0[0] = t1[0];
            t0[1] = t1[1];
            t0[2] = t1[2];
            q = GCD.quotient(temp[2], t0[2]);
            r = GCD.remainder(temp[2], t0[2]);
            t1[0] = temp[0] - t0[0] * q;
            t1[1] = temp[1] - t0[1] * q;
            t1[2] = r;
        }
        // The GCD is usually nonnegative.
        if (t0[2] < 0) {
            t0[0] *= -1;
            t0[1] *= -1;
            t0[2] *= -1;
        }
        return t0;
    }

    /**
     * Gives the quotient.
     * 
     * @param a the dividend.
     * @param b the divisor.
     * @return the quotient.
     * @throws ArithmeticException if b is zero.
     */
    public static int quotient(int a, int b) throws ArithmeticException {
        if (b == 0) {
            throw new ArithmeticException("Division by zero");
        }
        return GCD.division(a, b)[0];
    }

    /**
     * Gives the remainder.
     * 
     * @param a the dividend.
     * @param b the divisor.
     * @return the remainder.
     * @throws ArithmeticException if b is zero.
     */
    public static int remainder(int a, int b) throws ArithmeticException {
        if (b == 0) {
            throw new ArithmeticException("Division by zero");
        }
        return GCD.division(a, b)[1];
    }

    /**
     * Performs division.
     * 
     * @param a the dividend.
     * @param b the divisor.
     * @return a 2-array consisting of the quotient and remainder.
     * @throws ArithmeticException if b is zero.
     */
    public static int[] division(final int a, final int b) throws ArithmeticException {
        if (b == 0) {
            throw new ArithmeticException("Division by zero");
        } else {
            // Computes |a| / |b| and |a| % |b| first.
            int quotient = Math.abs(a) / Math.abs(b);
            int remainder = Math.abs(a) % Math.abs(b);
            // Suppose a, b > 0, with a = bq + r, 0 <= r < b. Then
            // a = (-b)(-q) + r
            // If r = 0, -a = b(-q) = (-b)q
            // If r > 0,
            // -a = b(-q) - r = b(-q) + (b - r) - b = b(-q-1) + (b - r)
            // -a = (-b)(q+1) + (-(-b) - r)
            //
            // If a >= 0, this part is ignored
            if (a < 0) {
                // If remainder = 0, this part is ignored
                if (remainder > 0) {
                    remainder = Math.abs(b) - remainder;
                    quotient = -quotient - 1;
                }
            }
            // If b > 0, this part is ignored
            if (b < 0) {
                quotient *= -1;
            }
            final int[] result = { quotient, remainder };
            return result;
        }
    }

}

entry.title: WRONG + WRONG = RIGHT
entry.content:
Solve the following puzzle, where O = 0 and no two distinct letters stand for the same integer.

  W R O N G
+ W R O N G
------------
  R I G H T

First, let's replace O by 0. Then

  W R 0 N G
+ W R 0 N G
------------
  R I G H T

Since 'NG' <= 99, we see that 'GHT' <= 198. Since G is not 0, G must be 1. Then

  W R 0 N 1
+ W R 0 N 1
------------
  R I 1 H 2

It is not hard to see N >= 5. H is of course 2N - 10. H cannot be 0, 1 or 2, so H = 2N - 10 >= 3, which implies that N is 7, 8 or 9.

Note that 'WR' + 'WR' = 'RI'. This means 20W + 2R = 10R + I, or I = 20W - 8R. Hence I is 4 or 8.

If I is 4, then 1 = 5W - 2R -> W = 1 + 2t, R = 2 + 5t. R must be 7 -> W must be 3. Then

  3 7 0 N 1
+ 3 7 0 N 1
------------
  7 4 1 H 2

Now N cannot be 7. If N = 8, then H = 6; if N = 9, then H = 8. Both are perfectly acceptable solutions.

  3 7 0 8 1                     3 7 0 9 1
+ 3 7 0 8 1         or        + 3 7 0 9 1
------------                  ------------
  7 4 1 6 2                     7 4 1 8 2

If I is 8, then 2 = 5W - 2R -> W = 2 + 2t, R = 4 + 5t. W cannot be 2, so W = 4, R = 9. Then

  4 9 0 N 1
+ 4 9 0 N 1
------------
  9 8 1 H 2

Now N cannot be 8 or 9. Then N = 7. However, this implies that H = 4, a contradiction.

Conclusion: the only two solutions are

  3 7 0 8 1                     3 7 0 9 1
+ 3 7 0 8 1         or        + 3 7 0 9 1
------------                  ------------
  7 4 1 6 2                     7 4 1 8 2

Of course, we can solve it by Java. Here is the code, whose file name is Main.java and belongs to package wrong_right.

package wrong_right;

/**
 * Main
 */
public class Main {

    public static void main(String... args) {
        long time = System.currentTimeMillis();
        System.out.println("");
        Main.solve();
        System.out.println("Time elapsed: " + (System.currentTimeMillis() - time) + " milliseconds.\n");
    }

    public static boolean beDistinct(int... integers) {
        for (int i = 0; i < integers.length - 1; i++) {
            for (int j = i + 1; j < integers.length; j++) {
                if (integers[i] == integers[j]) {
                    return false;
                }
            }
        }
        return true;
    }

    public static void solve() {
        // The variables are W, R, O, N, G, I, H, T, where O = 0.
        for (int w = 0; w <= 9; w++) {
            for (int r = 0; r <= 9; r++) {
                for (int n = 0; n <= 9; n++) {
                    for (int g = 0; g <= 9; g++) {
                        for (int i = 0; i <= 9; i++) {
                            for (int h = 0; h <= 9; h++) {
                                for (int t = 0; t <= 9; t++) {
                                    if (!Main.beDistinct(w, r, 0, n, g, i, h, t)) {
                                        continue;
                                    } else {
                                        if (2 * (10000 * w + 1000 * r + 10 * n + g) == 10000 * r + 1000 * i + 100 * g
                                                + 10 * h + t) {
                                            System.out.println(String.format("  %d %d %d %d %d", w, r, 0, n, g));
                                            System.out.println(String.format("+ %d %d %d %d %d", w, r, 0, n, g));
                                            System.out.println("------------");
                                            System.out.println(String.format("  %d %d %d %d %d", r, i, g, h, t));
                                            System.out.println("");
                                        }
                                    }
                                }
                            }
                        }
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }

entry.title: 最大乘积
entry.content:
我, septsea, 又来水了。Wow, I can really water experience.

有一些正整数和为 n, 求它们最大乘积。

我们简单分析 e 下。

首先, 如果有 r 个 1, 那么就相当于 r - k 个 > 1 个数在相乘 (r 是数字个数)。2 * (w - 1) 不比 1 * w 香?

其次, 对于一个数 w 而言, 2 * (w - 2) = w + (w - 4), 3 * (w - 3) = w + (2w - 9), 所以, 不小于 5 的数 w 应当拆开。

4 可以写成 2 + 2 (当然也可以写成 2 * 2), 所以 WLOG (您觉得这该怎么读呢?), 把 4 拆为 2 个 2。

对于 6 而言, 6 = 2 + 2 + 2 = 3 + 3, 因为 2 * 2 * 2 < 3 * 3, 所以每 3 个 2 都应用 2 个 3 代替。

所以, 只要 n >= 2, 为了使乘积最大, 绝对不应出现 1, 尽可能用 3 填满, 剩下的用 2 填。

n = 1 时没得说, 乘积就是 1。n = 2 时, 1 个 2 就可, 从而最大乘积为 2。n = 3 时, 1 个 3 就可, 从而最大乘积为 3。n = 4 时, 2 个 2 就可, 从而最大乘积为 4。

n >= 5 时, 尽可能用 3 填满。设 n = 3q + r, 0 <= r <= 2。

r = 0 意味着可以全部用 3 填满, 从而最大乘积为 3 * 3 ^ (q - 1)。

r = 1 时应当用 q - 1 个 3 与 2 个 2 填满, 从而最大乘积为 4 * 3 ^ (q - 1)。

r = 2 意味着可以用 q 个 3 与 1 个 2 填满, 从而最大乘积为 6 * 3 ^ (q - 1)。

q = [n / 3], r = n - 3q, [x] 是不超过 x 的最大整数。

entry.content:
A set SSS consists of 7 distinct integers x0<x1<⋯<x6x_0 < x_1 < \cdots < x_6x0​<x1​<⋯<x6​. If the set { x−y: x,y∈S,  x≠yx-y: \ x,y\in S, \ \ x \neq yx−y: x,y∈S,  x​=y } has 42 elements, find the minimum of x6−x0x_6-x_0x6​−x0​.

Generalize the problem. (***This is too hard for me...***)

Answer. 25.

Solution. Brute force is a good method. Create a Java package named minimum_problem, and then create two Java files.

File: Main.java

package minimum_problem;

/**
 * Main
 */
public class Main {

    public static void main(final String... args) {
        long time = System.currentTimeMillis();
        solver(100);
        System.out.println("\nTime elapsed: " + (System.currentTimeMillis() - time) + " milliseconds.\n");
    }

    /**
     * Gives the set D = {y - x : x, y are in {@code py_list} and x < y}.
     * 
     * @param py_list the list.
     * @return the set D.
     */
    public static PyList difference(final PyList py_list) {
        final PyList result = new PyList();
        final PyList temp = py_list.toSet();
        for (int i = 0; i < temp.length() - 1; i++) {
            for (int j = i + 1; j < temp.length(); j++) {
                result.appendsIfAbsent(temp.visits(j) - temp.visits(i));
            }
        }
        return result;
    }

    /**
     * Gives an answer with x0 = 0 and x6 < upper. If no such answer exists, it
     * gives a list consisting of seven -1's.
     * 
     * @param upper an upper bound for x6.
     * @return an answer with x0 = 0 and x6 < upper.
     */
    public static PyList solver1(final int upper) {
        final PyList answer = new PyList();
        for (int x1 = 1; x1 <= upper; x1++) {
            for (int x2 = 1; x2 <= upper; x2++) {
                for (int x3 = 1; x3 <= upper; x3++) {
                    for (int x4 = 1; x4 <= upper; x4++) {
                        for (int x5 = 1; x5 <= upper; x5++) {
                            for (int x6 = 1; x6 <= upper; x6++) {
                                // Sets x0 to be 0, without loss of generality.
                                answer.replacedBy(new PyList(0, x1, x2, x3, x4, x5, x6).toSet());
                                if (difference(answer).length() == 21 && answer.visits(6) < upper) {
                                    return answer;
                                }
                            }
                        }
                    }
                }
            }
        }
        // If no such answer exists, execute the following line.
        return new PyList(-1, -1, -1, -1, -1, -1, -1);
    }

    /**
     * Looks for the minimum solution, given an initial upper bound.
     * 
     * @param arg an initial upper bound.
     */
    public static void solver(final int arg) {
        int upper = arg;
        final PyList answer = new PyList();
        while (true) {
            answer.replacedBy(solver1(upper));
            // Decrease the upper bound.
            upper = answer.visits(6);
            if (upper == -1) {
                break;
            } else {
                // Prints a solution. The last line would be the minimum solution.
                System.out.println(answer);
            }
        }
    }

}

package minimum_problem;

/**
 * PyList
 */
public class PyList {

    public static final int MAX_LENGTH = 150;
    private final int[] list;
    private int size;

    /** Initializes the list. */
    public PyList() {
        this.list = new int[PyList.MAX_LENGTH];
        this.resets();
    }

    /**
     * Initializes the list with {@code data}. The elements of {@code data} will be
     * appended to the list.
     * 
     * @param data the elements to be appended.
     */
    public PyList(final int... data) {
        this();
        this.appends(data);
    }

    /**
     * Initializes the list with {@code py_lists}. The elements of {@code py_lists}
     * will be appended to the list.
     * 
     * @param py_lists the lists to be appended.
     */
    public PyList(final PyList... py_lists) {
        this();
        this.appends(py_lists);
    }

    /** Does nothing. */
    public void appends() {

    }

    /**
     * Appends the elements of {@code data} to the list.
     * 
     * @param data the elements to be appended.
     */
    public void appends(final int... data) {
        for (final int datum : data) {
            this.sets(this.length(), datum);
        }
    }

    /**
     * Appends the elements of {@code py_lists} to the list.
     * 
     * @param py_lists the lists to be appended.
     */
    public void appends(final PyList... py_lists) {
        for (final PyList py_list : py_lists) {
            this.appends(py_list.toArray());
        }
    }

    /**
     * Appends {@code element} to the list if it was not in the list.
     * 
     * @param element the element to be appended.
     * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code element} was not in the list.
     */
    public boolean appendsIfAbsent(final int element) {
        if (!this.contains(element)) {
            this.appends(element);
            return true;
        }
        return false;
    }

    /**
     * Validates whether {@code element} is in the list.
     * 
     * @param element the element to be searched.
     * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code element} is in the list.
     */
    public boolean contains(final int element) {
        return this.indexOf(element) != -1;
    }

    @Override
    public boolean equals(final Object other) {
        if (this == other) {
            return true;
        }
        if (other instanceof PyList) {
            final PyList py_list = (PyList) other;
            int n = this.length();
            if (n == py_list.length()) {
                int i = 0;
                while (n-- != 0) {
                    if (this.visits(i) != py_list.visits(i)) {
                        return false;
                    }
                    i++;
                }
                return true;
            }
        }
        return false;
    }

    /**
     * A shortcut to {@code indexOf(element, 0)}.
     * 
     * @param element the element to be searched.
     * @return {@code indexOf(element, 0)}.
     */
    public int indexOf(final int element) {
        return this.indexOf(element, 0);
    }

    /**
     * Looks for the index {@code i} with the properties that {@code beginIndex < i}
     * and that the element at index {@code i} is {@code element}. Gives -1 if no
     * such index exists.
     * 
     * @param element    the element to be searched.
     * @param beginIndex the beginning index.
     * @return the index with the properties above, or -1 if no such index exists.
     */
    public int indexOf(final int element, final int beginIndex) {
        for (int index = beginIndex; index < this.length(); index++) {
            if (this.visits(index) == element) {
                return index;
            }
        }
        return -1;
    }

    /**
     * Gives the length of the list.
     * 
     * @return the length of the size.
     */
    public int length() {
        return this.size;
    }

    /**
     * Gives the last element and removes it.
     * 
     * @return the last element.
     */
    public int pops() {
        return this.pops(this.length() - 1);
    }

    /**
     * Gives the element at index {@code index} and removes it.
     * 
     * @param index the index.
     * @return the element at index {@code index}.
     */
    public int pops(final int index) {
        final PyList temp_list = new PyList();
        final int integer_popped = this.visits(index);
        for (int i = 0; i < this.length(); i++) {
            if (i != index) {
                temp_list.appends(this.visits(i));
            }
        }
        this.replacedBy(temp_list);
        return integer_popped;
    }

    /**
     * Replaces the current list by {@code py_list}.
     * 
     * @param py_list the list.
     */
    public void replacedBy(final PyList py_list) {
        this.resets();
        this.appends(py_list);
    }

    /** Resets the list. */
    public void resets() {
        for (int i = 0; i < PyList.MAX_LENGTH; i++) {
            this.list[i] = 0;
        }
        this.size = 0;
    }

    /**
     * Sets the element at index {@code index} to be {@code element}.
     * 
     * @param index   the index.
     * @param element the element.
     */
    public void sets(final int index, final int element) {
        this.list[index] = element;
        if (index >= this.size) {
            this.size = index + 1;
        }
    }

    /**
     * Sorts the list.
     */
    public void sort() {
        this.replacedBy(this.sorted());
    }

    /**
     * Gives the sorted list of the current one.
     * 
     * @return the sorted list.
     */
    public PyList sorted() {
        final PyList sorted_list = new PyList(this);
        int temporary = 0;
        for (int i = 0; i < sorted_list.length() - 1; i++) {
            for (int j = i + 1; j < sorted_list.length(); j++) {
                if (sorted_list.visits(i) > sorted_list.visits(j)) {
                    temporary = sorted_list.visits(i);
                    sorted_list.sets(i, sorted_list.visits(j));
                    sorted_list.sets(j, temporary);
                }
            }
        }
        return sorted_list;
    }

    /**
     * Converts the list to an array.
     * 
     * @return an array ({@code int[]}).
     */
    public int[] toArray() {
        final int[] array = new int[this.length()];
        for (int i = 0; i < this.length(); i++) {
            array[i] = this.visits(i);
        }
        return array;
    }

    /**
     * Converts the list to a set.
     * 
     * @return a list with no element occurring more than one time.
     */
    public PyList toSet() {
        final PyList set = new PyList();
        for (int i = 0; i < this.length(); i++) {
            set.appendsIfAbsent(this.visits(i));
        }
        return set.sorted();
    }

    @Override
    public String toString() {
        String text = "";
        int index = 0;
        for (; index < this.length() - 1; index++) {
            text += "" + this.visits(index) + " ";
        }
        text += "" + this.visits(index);
        return text;
    }

    /**
     * Visits the element at index {@code index}.
     *
